correctness.rationale: Large portions of the extracted data are fabricated or not traceable to the article and there is at least one schema violation. Key issues: (1) Device data error: thresholdVoltage is given as -37 V but the article reports -0.37 V (Table I and text). (2) Unreported IGZO process details were invented: plasma power (50 W), deposition temperature (100 °C), reactor pressure (0.1 mTorr), dosing/purge times, flow rates, nucleation period, growth-per-cycle, number of cycles—all not stated in the paper. (3) Reactant selection is not supported: “In-Ga bimetallic precursor” and “O2 plasma” for IGZO are not reported; only the Al2O3 GI uses TMA/H2O and N2 purge (and that is a different layer). (4) Supercycle design is incorrect: the paper states In2O3:Ga2O3:ZnO = 1:1:1, but the extraction collapses everything into a single “InGaZnO” subcycle and does not represent the 1:1:1 sub-cycle ratio. (5) Substrate is mis-specified: “SiO2/Si” is not stated. (6) Material properties (refractive index, absorption, band gap, resistivity, carrier density, Hall mobility, uniformity, conformality, roughness, density) and XPS-derived composition are not reported; the extraction assigns values and methods (e.g., XPS depth profile, AFM, XRR) without evidence. (7) Schema violation: processParameters includes a root-level filmThickness property that is not defined in processParameters (additionalProperties is false). Properties to correct/review: thresholdVoltage (set to -0.37 V), remove or revise all ungrounded reactant, parameter, and material-property values; represent supercycle with In2O3/Ga2O3/ZnO subcycles at 1:1:1; avoid unstated substrate; ensure only schema-defined properties are present.

completeness.rationale: Largely incomplete/incorrect with many untraceable or fabricated values and a missing ALD process. (1) Multiple processes: The article reports two ALD processes (PEALD IGZO and thermal-ALD Al2O3 with TMA/H2O at 150 °C, N2 purge). Only the IGZO process was extracted; the Al2O3 ALD is missing as a separate process instance. (2) IGZO ALD details are mostly invented: precursor (“In-Ga bimetallic precursor”), co-reactant (“O2 plasma”), plasma power (50 W), deposition temperature (100 °C), pressure (0.1 mTorr), dosing/purge times, flow rates, saturation/nucleation, growth per cycle (0.12 Å), and number of cycles (83) are not provided anywhere in the article. (3) Supercycle design is not represented correctly: IGZO is shown as a single subcycle; the paper reports a 1:1:1 In2O3:Ga2O3:ZnO molar ratio, implying subcycles for each oxide. The subcycleSequence and numberofSubcycles should list In2O3, Ga2O3, ZnO with counts consistent with 1:1:1. (4) Substrate description (“ITO on SiO2/Si”) is not stated in the text and is not traceable. (5) Material properties (refractive index, absorption coefficient, band gap, uniformity, conformality, roughness, density) and the XPS characterization method for composition are not reported and appear fabricated; only amorphous phase and 1:1:1 ratio are supported. (6) Device metrics: threshold voltage is wrong by two orders of magnitude (-37 V extracted vs -0.37 V reported at pre-anneal 200 °C/post-anneal 200 °C). Mobility, SS, and I_ON/I_OFF match the article. To improve completeness: add a second ALD process for Al2O3 (TALD, TMA/H2O, 150 °C, N2 purge); correct V_TH to -0.37 V; represent the IGZO supercycle with In2O3/Ga2O3/ZnO subcycles at 1:1:1; remove or leave unspecified any IGZO parameters not reported (precursors, plasma power, dosing/purge/flows, temperature, pressure, GPC, cycles), and only include film properties that are explicitly given (amorphous IGZO, 10 nm thickness, 1:1:1 ratio).
